TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PushStreamContent extends System.Net.Http.HttpContent

Docs.summary: Provides an implementation that exposes an output which can be written to directly. The ability to push data to the output stream differs from the where data is pulled and not pushed.

MemberSignature.Value: public PushStreamContent (Action<System.IO.Stream,System.Net.Http.HttpContent,System.Net.TransportContext> onStreamAvailable);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Action`3<class System.IO.Stream, class System.Net.Http.HttpContent, class System.Net.TransportContext> onStreamAvailable) cil managed
Public Sub New (onStreamAvailable As Action(Of Stream, HttpContent, TransportContext))
new System.Net.Http.PushStreamContent : Action<System.IO.Stream, System.Net.Http.HttpContent, System.Net.TransportContext> -> System.Net.Http.PushStreamContent

Docs.param: The action to call when an output stream is available.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. The action is called when an output stream has become available allowing the action to write to it directly. When the stream is closed, it will signal to the content that is has completed and the HTTP request or response will be completed.

Docs.param: The action to call when an output stream is available. The stream is automatically closed when the return task is completed.

Protected Overrides Function SerializeToStreamAsync (stream As Stream, context As TransportContext) As Task
override this.SerializeToStreamAsync : System.IO.Stream * System.Net.TransportContext -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task

Docs.summary: When this method is called, it calls the action provided in the constructor with the output stream to write to. Once the action has completed its work it closes the stream which will close this content instance and complete the HTTP request or response.
Docs.returns: A instance that is asynchronously serializing the object's content.
